intro: Ascolepis dipsacoides subsp. siamensis, commonly known as the Siam hedge bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth and along stream banks.
